overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a structured approach to time-series forecasting for hourly transformer load data. The analyst identifies daily seasonality, checks for trends and missing values, evaluates advanced models like SARIMA and Exponential Smoothing, but ultimately selects a simple averaging method due to limited historical data (only 4 days). The solution focuses on practicality, computing hourly averages from historical data and projecting them forward while ensuring output formatting consistency.
common_data_patterns: Higher nighttime values and lower daytime values
No missing values in provided data
key_insights: Prioritizing simplicity when historical data is limited (4 days)
Using same-hour averages across days to capture seasonality
Rounding forecasts to match input data precision (3 decimals)
Generating identical daily patterns in absence of clear trend
Validating timestamp continuity for output formatting
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with practical simplification: Starts with advanced model considerations but reverts to heuristic averaging after data inspection. Includes manual pattern analysis, multi-step computation of hourly averages, and output generation logic.
